answers.answer: ugh i feel for you. i also have just been told that i am at high risk for preeclampsia and failed my 1-hour GD test.I am also 261/2 weeks with g/g twins. No bedrest yet, but the doctor has asked that i stop going into work and stay at home (havent told my boss this yet!)good lluck with everything, i am sure we will have three healthy girls when this is all over with, just try to stay positive!

looks like you'll be riding the bedsheets too!  my doc told me that if you get preeclampsia or gd, to expect to get the other.  i guess they go hand in hand.  this may not be true with all cases, but it's pretty normal.  what's with our little girls and causing us problems!?!?!?!?  i thought boys were the big problem causers!  lol

Do you mind saying if those of you who developed GD and/ore preeclampsia had risk factors like being overweight, older age, etc? I'm worried of getting these b/c overweight though lost weight before getting pregant but still considered overweight. I exercise daily but who knows how much longer I can do that as I'm now 26 weeks pregnant. I try to eat healthy but not the best - I like carbs and not crazy about fruits/veggies but eating more for my baby and my health since pregnant. I'm having the glucose test next week, so we'll see what happens. My blood pressure has been up lately at the OB b/c worried about these things but normal at home, but then she worries me about getting preeclampsia b/c of high b.p. but urine/blood tests normal for that so far. Sorry you all have to deal with this, but I worry about it too b/c of these risk factors!
Little boys are angels...they wouldn't do that to their mama's! LOL Good luck girls!

Gestational diabetes sux I got it with both times I was pregnant with my girls I was lucky I didnt test positive until 28 weeks and when your pregnant all you crave for is chocolate well I did and couldnt have it but apples helped my sweet urge. The main thing at the end is having a healthy baby my 1st ended in c section at 39 weeks 8lb 9oz and 2nd at 38 weeks 7lb 11oz. One bonus is after I had my babys I was slightly lighter than before I was pregnant I've now got to get motivated to change my lifestyle as im at risk for diabetes later in life. Sorry to hear what your going thru good luck for the rest of your pregnancy:)
Guess I am one of the lucky ones!!!!!! At 6'4' tall 30 weeks 5 days pregnant and a whopping 365lbs I passed the 1 hr glucose test. I was really surprised.

question: hi ladies!  ok, not only do i have preclampsia and thin membrane disease in my kidney's, but now we can add gestational diabetes!  GRRRRRRRRREAT!  talk about luck.  i knew i was going to get it because of being on bedrest and no exercise.... but i also thought that maybe i'd be ok because i've really been watching what i eat.  i've been steadily losing weight since the beginning (which my doc says is ok for a girl of my "stature"), so my lifestyle has been much healthier now than pre-pregnancy.  today she measured 26weeks 3 days, which is exactly how far along i am.  my doc said that it's possible for her to be a bigger baby, but as of right now, she's looking really good.  i'm just wondering what else can get thrown my direction.... and i say to that, BRING IT ON! i'll do anything to keep her healthy!Blessings!~Candace
title: results from glucose test
